Title: ESPH TW Hastings Sustainable Mobility Seafront - Feasibility Study (ESPH291) - AWARD
Description:
Hastings Borough Council has committed to revitalising the town of Hastings over the last few years, including launching various regeneration initiatives connected to Hastings Seafront.
      
      The Council has been granted funding from the European Union's Interreg programme -  DESTI-SMART (Delivering Efficient Sustainable Tourism with low-carbon transport Innovations: Sustainable Mobility, Accessibility and Responsible Travel) to investigate the option of installing a low-carbon, sustainable method of transport on the Seafront to help deliver sustainable tourism to the historic town.
      
      Using the grant funding Hastings Borough Council is seeking to appoint a suitably qualified and experienced consultant who can provide a feasibility study on sustainable transport options for Hastings' Seafront and support the Council in presenting an action plan for the DESTI-SMART project.
      
      Full information is available in the tender documentation.

Title: Heathrow Rail Access Programme
Description:
The multi-billion pound Heathrow Rail Access (HRA) programme is a Secretary of State priority and brings together the proposed Western and Southern rail links to Heathrow into a single holistic programme. These schemes seek to improve access to Heathrow Airport for both business, leisure travellers and airport workforce, by improving rail connectivity to the airport.

As part of the CP5 settlement funding was agreed to progress the Western rail link (WRLtH) through a Development Consent Order, with the aim of commencing construction work during CP6. Southern access (SRLtH) is at an earlier stage of development and funding is currently being sought to undertake a GRIP 1-2 study.

Recent work to assess the wider network capacity and capability alongside the existing Heathrow infrastructure has revealed that, given the level of services expected to be operating to Heathrow Terminal 5 by December 2019, there will be no platform availability for future HRA services. This issue could be resolved by bringing platforms 1 & 2, which are currently within a safeguarded station box at Terminal 5, into use. The options and costs for fitting out the station box at Terminal 5 have not previously been considered by the Department or Network Rail.

The purpose of this work is to provide an independent view on the cost and fit out of the station box. This is required in order to inform part of our negotiating brief for a contribution from Heathrow Airport Limited. We have been clear publicly that progressing WRLtH is dependent on agreeing an appropriate contribution from the airport and this is critical to supporting our efforts to ensure the schemes are affordable and value for money. There is a critical dependency on this work as the contribution negotiations and accompanying 'funding statement' for the scheme need to be completed in time to inform the DCO submission.

Title: ESCC RS - Transport for the South East - Economic Connectivity Review Consultancy.  - AWARD
Description:
ESPO 664 Framework mini Competition. Lot 5.
      
      1 Introduction 
      2 Transport for the South East (TfSE) is a newly established shadow sub-national transport body representing 16 Local Transport Authorities (LTAs) and five Local Enterprise Partnerships (LEPs) in the South East .  
      
      3 The aim of TfSE is to support and grow the economy in the South East by identifying and prioritising a programme of strategic transport interventions. It also aims to improve the experience of the travelling public and businesses and bring about more reliable journeys free of congestion, whilst safeguarding the environment.   
      
      4 The key mechanism for expressing how TfSE will realise its vision and strategic priorities will be through its transport strategy to provide the basis for making recommendations on priorities for transport investment in the region. A route map for the development of the transport strategy has been produced setting out the work packages that will need to be completed to produce the transport strategy. 
      
      5 The initial stage of the transport strategy route map is an economic connectivity review.  This is intended to build on existing evidence and previous studies to provide an overarching view of the region's economic geography and functionality and transport's role within it. Critically, it will ensure that the transport strategy is grounded in the key issues around the economic impact of improved connectivity recognising that the region comprises a range of distinct functional economic areas. 
      
      6 This Invitation to Tender is being issued as a Further Competition under Lot 5 Highways Transport and Logistics of ESPO's Consultancy Services Framework (reference 664_17) to undertake the economic connectivity review. Separate invitations to tender consisting of one or more of the other work packages shown on the route map in the tender documents.

Title: 0358 SELEP Independent Technical Advisor
Description:
SELEP, the biggest of 39 LEPs nationally in terms of geography and numbers of businesses, is a public/private
sector partnership tasked with supporting economic growth – in the shape of jobs and homes – across the areas
of East Sussex, Essex, Kent, Medway, Southend and Thurrock. Critical to this is the successful delivery of its
responsibilities around the Local Growth Fund. SELEP will oversee a programme worth at least £488m up to
2021 and the technical evaluation of schemes is therefore of the utmost importance to the LEP’s operation.
Further information on the SELEP can be found on the website:
http://www.southeastlep.com/
The South East Local Enterprise Partnership (SELEP) requires consultancy services for the role of Independent
Technical Evaluator (ITE) primarily to work with SELEP project promoters to obtain formal sign-off of business
cases by the SELEP Board to enable funding to continue to flow.

Title: ENVIRONMENT & TRANSPORT - COMMISSIONING FRAMEWORK (E&T-CF)
Description: Leicestershire County Council (Council) has established a framework agreement with several consultants for the provision of transport and land use planning and modelling consultancy advice. The prime purpose of the advice is to support the Council and other user organisations the use of its comprehensive transport model called the Leicester and Leicestershire Integrated Transport Model. (LLITM).
